title: Shop Safety!
description: Get Shop certified!

title: Shop Safety!
description: Get Shop certified!

title: Product Design/DigiFab
description: We will be covering design tools (software and hardware) for digital fabrication.

title: Early version – From Story to Tech: a methodology project
description: Advanced, earlier date of my presentation on the 17th for those of you who wish to get ideas for your Camp projects a little sooner.

title: AT&T AdWorks Lab Tour
description: I’ll give a quick and informal tour of the AdWorks Media Lab.  We’ll look at how we used Cinder to create some very cool (at least we think so!) data visualizations and explain how we developed the narrative for the entire space.  You can see the pool table that will soon be transformed into a completely, interactive experience!    Lastly, you’ll also get a sneak peek at the redesign that we’re currently doing that will launch in September.

title: Seeing Like a Network: Learning to think about digital security
description: This is an interactive workshop in digital security focused on what’s called “Threat Modeling” in the computer security world — understanding how the networks you use see you, and how to realistically defend against the most likely attacks. We’ll cover some security tools and techniques, but we’ll focused making the networked environment legible enough to let you seek out tools and techniques suited to your situation.
comment:
attending the first hour!
 so interesting!

title: Intro to the Soft Lab
description: This workshop will introduce you to the basics of using ITP’s soft lab resources — specifically the sewing machines, the embroidery machine, and the vinyl cutter.  This will mostly be a demo session, so no materials are required!
comment: can notes or resources be shared on the blog afterwards?

title: Wearables Hack Day
description: Do you sew? Do you play with microcontrollers? Then join us for ITP Camp wearables hack day!

title: Field trip to Bitfoms Gallery and Eyebeam
description: We’re going to visit http://www.bitforms.com and http://www.eyebeam.org. Feel free to join us.

title: Laser Cutter 102
description: For everyone that wants to get up and running on the laser cutter.  We’ll go over all of the basics for cutting and etching.  Please come with ideas and materials.

title: Don’t Go Back to School–independent learning for everybody
description: Forget education reform, let’s transform learning itself! I’m excited to share the research that went into my recently published handbook on independent learning called Don’t Go Back to School, based on interviews with 100 independent learners. Let’s talk about how independent learning works, and how to get more people doing it and taking it seriously, and how it fits into the future of education, daily life, and the world we want to live in. My next contribution to the cause will be a set of guidelines for learning oriented working groups. I’d love to hear your approaches.

title: Improv Electronics with TinkerKit for Arduino
description: TinkerKit is a shield for Arduino that makes it super fast and easy to prototype interactivity by just plugging in sensors and actuators without having to worry about extra circuitry, breadboarding, etc…

title: Jitter Workshop: Coding for Video Art
Akimitsu Sadoi – LED Artist Workshop
description: Aki has offered to do a build workshop which should be quite fun and you’ll have something to take with you. It’s the simplest circuit with the least number of components (see image below). Yet it does share the same technical principle (multiplex LED drive with PWM) with more complex designs of his. He also think it’s a good material to get started with surface mount soldering.
comment: yes, attending. should be on the list for supplies already. thanks!

title: Learn vim
description: Attention campers!  Anyone wanna learn vim?

title: EAGLE PCB Design Software – Intro Session
Building + Sculpting in Second Life (continued from Monday)
description: This is an extra SecondLife hour on the calendar for Wednesday at 5pm to finish our building tutorial. Hope you can attend.

title: Building Websites with Twitter Bootstrap
description: Hi! This is a hands-on workshop where we are going to build a single page portfolio site with Twitter Bootstrap.

title: Funding Your Work: Grants and Crowd Funding
description: Ann Bennett and Theresa Loong will be presenting from 7-8:30pm.
comment: attending! a bit late but should be there!

title: Intel Perceptual Computing Lab
description: Hear about the latest projects from the Intel Perceptual Computing Lab!

title: Guest Lecture: Inventing a mechatronic transmission
description: In this talk and workshop, Tony Wong will discuss his invention: A new kind of transmission that uses high speed mechatronics to instantaneously “change gears” in a way that has never been done before. Tony will share technical information not previously released in public, and will also talk about his company’s challenges of developing and patenting his invention, raising capital, and the current endeavor of bringing it to market.
comment: i will be there for the beginning, thank you

title: End-of-Camp Shindig
description: Half show & tell, half party, the End of Camp Shindig is an opportunity to celebrate the month we’ve spent together and share what we’ve created.

title: Camp Fellows Lightening Talks!
description: Fellows will be giving 5 minute action packed talks on their work and time during ITP Camp!
